After backing up the system, the next step is to determine the root cause of the issue. The technician should establish a theory of probable cause, which is an educated guess as to why the issue is occurring. This can be done by reviewing the information gathered from the user and the findings so far, and researching the issue internally or externally (e.g., online forums, vendor support) as needed. Once the technician has a better understanding of the issue, they can then move on to determining the next steps to resolve the issue and documenting their findings, actions, and outcomes (A. Determine the next steps to resolve the issue and document it and C. Document the findings, actions, and outcomes). If necessary, the technician can then design a plan of action to resolve the issue and implement the solution (B. Design a plan of action to resolve the issue and implement the solution).

Developing a plan of action to resolve the issue is an important step for the technician before attempting to implement any solutions. This will help them ensure that the resolution process is systematic and effective, as well as helping them to document findings, actions, and outcomes at each stage. Once a plan of action has been developed, the technician can move on to establishing a probable cause of the issue and researching internally or externally as necessary to find potential solutions. After finding a solution, they should then be able to implement it with confidence in order to resolve the issue. Documenting findings, actions, and outcomes at each stage is important for future reference and problem-solving. It will also help them evaluate their own performance and success in resolving the issue. Therefore, the best answer is option B:

questions.question_text: A technician identified an issue on a workstation, obtained details from the user, and made a backup of the system. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

A user reports that a laser printer continues to print pages with text that is too light to read even after adding additional toner. Which of the following should the technician replace to correct this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To correct the issue of laser printer pages printing text too light to read even after adding additional toner, the technician should consider replacing:

D. Transfer drum

Explanation:

The transfer drum (also known as the imaging drum or photoconductor) is a crucial component in the laser printing process. It plays a key role in transferring the toner onto the paper.

If the transfer drum is worn out or defective, it may not effectively transfer the toner onto the paper, resulting in light or faded printouts.

Adding additional toner (which is related to the toner cartridge) might not resolve the issue if the transfer drum is the root cause.

A technician is diagnosing the cause of the degraded status of a RAID 5 array of five HDDs. Which of the following steps should the technician complete first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When diagnosing the degraded status of a RAID 5 array, the technician should complete the following step first:

A. Review the RAID log.

Explanation:

Reviewing the RAID log (Option A) can provide valuable information about any events, errors, or warnings related to the RAID array. It may help identify the cause of the degradation.
